head.title: Preface.11 Printed in Poems (1794), p. i.

body.p: Prevented, by many concurring circumstances, from pursuing the liberal plan of education I had once the prospect of accomplishing;22 Cf. “Preface” in Poetical Essays (1788); son of a dyer, Turnbull left school young, working as a carpet-weaver in Kilmarnock. See See Thomas Crichton, “Biographical Sketches of Alexander Wilson,” in The Weaver [Paisley], 2 (1819); extract reprinted in Paterson, The Contemporaries of Burns (Edinburgh: Hugh Paton, etc., 1840), pp. 23-24 and Scott, "Introduction" in A Bard Unkend (Columbia: Scottish Poetry Reprints, 2015), pp. 5-7. I have not the vanity to imagine the following pieces finished with that accuracy that will stand the test of rigid criticism:—therefore, to the inspection of the lovers of poesy, as it flows spontaneous from the mind, unadorned by rules of art, I submit these juvenile productions—Their candid censure or approbation will ever oblige,
